becomes hard also in his dealings with men” (Kant, 1963, p. 240). Feinberg ar-
gues that infanticide is wrong, not because infants have the right to life, but
because our society’s protection of infants has social utility. If we do not treat
infants with tenderness and consideration, then when they are persons they
will be worse off and we will be worse off also (Feinberg, 1986, p. 271).
